intro: Thymelaea tarton-raira subsp. tarton-raira, commonly known as the Kankar Flower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It is adapted to harsh environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
